newsitem.title: USA: Plains feedlot cattle bid $72, $74 asked -feedlots.
newsitem.headline: Plains feedlot cattle bid $72, $74 asked -feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains cattle markets Thursday were quiet, with packers bidding $72.00 per cwt but cattle feeders generally pricing animals at $74.00, feedlot sources said.
Sales were expected to be light Thursday.

"They (packers) could buy the world at $73.00, but we'll probably see more light sales at $72.00," according to one Panhandle feedlot operator. Those waiting to sell at $73.00 will probably be content to sit back and wait, knowing that more than a few cattle on showlists could use extra days on feed, he said.
Packers also have adequate live inventories following last week's active sales and can afford to wait while picking up some extra loads Thursday at $72.00.
Packers may further be reluctant to pay higher prices for cattle as they watch boxed beef prices tumble.
However, the lower prices were moving boxes, sources noted.
Boxed beef prices Wednesday were quoted down $0.25 to $0.98 per cwt on 310 loads of fabricated cuts sold, USDA said.
